properties.areaDesc: Southern Centre; Blair; Clearfield; Northern Centre; Huntingdon
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 8 at 9:04AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which
can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 903 AM EST, a snow squall was along a line
extending from Chester Hill to 8 miles north of Prince Gallitzin
State Park and moving east at 40 MPH.

THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR...
South Philipsburg, Philipsburg and North Philipsburg around 910 AM
EST.
Black Moshannon State Park around 915 AM EST.
Port Matilda around 920 AM EST.
Stormstown around 925 AM EST.
Tyrone, Park Forest Village and Julian around 930 AM EST.
State College, Bald Eagle and Warriors Mark around 935 AM EST.

This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 48 to 75.

SAFETY INFO...
Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall.
Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to
lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this squall passes
your location.

Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be
prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra
time to reach your destination.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CENTRE...CLEARFIELD... BLAIR...and HUNTINGDON COUNTIES
